Laura Sager and Stephen Bruce Cohen, law professors, were married yesterday at the bridegroom's home in Washington by Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg of the Supreme Court.

The bride, who specializes in employment discrimination law, teaches the civil rights clinic at the New York University School of Law. The bridegroom, a faculty member at the Georgetown University Law Center in Washington, specializes in federal income tax law.

The bride is keeping her name. She graduated from Wellesley College and received her law degree from the University of California in Los Angeles. She is the daughter of the late Sophie and Jacob Lippman, who lived and worked in New York. Her father was a lawyer in private practice; her mother, a book editor.

The bridegroom was a deputy assistant secretary of state for human rights in the Carter administration. He graduated from Amherst College and the Yale Law School. His parents, Alma and Sylvan Cohen, live in Philadelphia, where his father is chairman of the Pennsylvania Real Estate Investment Trust.
The bride's previous marriage ended in divorce, as did the bridegroom's.
